intro: Tabernaemontana laeta, commonly known as the Happy Tree or White Star, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its showy, fragrant white or pink flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has elliptical, dark green leaves and produces elliptical berries that contain toxic seeds. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. Due to its medicinal properties, it is also used in traditional medicine.
